item.title: Moved to a new domain
Code-like linting for prose
item.description: I’m a big fan of static analysis and linting for code. If a computer can do it automatically - why rely on humans to do the same thing? That’s one of the reasons why I’m such a big proponent of static typing. I try to bring linting everywhere: When I had to deal with huge and complex HAProxy configs - I wrote a linter myself. When later at different place I had to deal with complicated business logic expressed as a state machine - I used Python AST to write a linter for it, and analyze cycles, dead ends and complexity.
